clinical_study.brief_title: Elastic Compression in Chronic Venous Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Randomised Trial Comparing the Effectiveness of Elastic Compression in Treating Chronic Venous Disease (CEAP C2-C5)

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with chronic venous disease causing pain or ache will be randomised into two groups, active stockings (18-21 mmHg) or placebo stockings

detailed_description.textblock: Patients with chronic venous disease causing pain or ache satisfying the inclusion and exclusion criteria will be randomised into two groups, active stockings (18-21 mmHg) or placebo stockings. The primary outcome of the study (pain/ache scored using a visual analogue scale) and a number of secondary symptoms, signs and rVCSS (revised Venous Clinical Severity Score) will be obtained at baseline and after one week of wearing the active or placebo stocking.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Pain/ache assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
primary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for dull pain of ache. This will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Heaviness assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for heaviness. This will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Night cramps assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for night cramps. These will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Swelling sensation assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for sensation of swelling. This will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Burning sensation assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for burning sensation. This will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Paresthesia assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for paresthesia. This will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: Restless legs assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for restless legs. This symptom will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: throbbing assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for throbbing of their varicose veins. This will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)

secondary_outcome.measure: insomnia assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with varicose veins often complain for insomnia. This will be assessed using a visual analogue scale (0-10)
This will be measured just above the malleoli, at the smallest point.

intervention.description: Use of elastic stockings to alleviate patient symptoms
Placebo stocking with pressure applied to the legs

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Primary varicose veins causing pain/ache located only at the calf level
Exclusion Criteria:
- Venous ulceration
- Dermatitis
- Itching
- Superficial vein thrombosis
- Peripheral arterial disease
- Symptoms of non-venous origin
- Previous use of elastic stockings
